law.catch_line: Exemption from pharmacy licensing requirements for common carriers transporting drugs.
law.text:
The provisions of KRS 315.320 do not apply to a person who is:
A common or contract carrier or warehouseman, or any employee thereof, unless the person is acting outside of the usual course of his business or employment or knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the act or transaction is unlawful; or
An employee or agent of a pharmacist or pharmacy licensed or permitted pursuant to this chapter and acting in accordance with KRS Chapter 218A, unless the person is acting outside of the usual course of his business or employment or knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the act or transaction is unlawful; or
The intended recipient of a substance or drug, unless the intended recipient knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the act or transaction is unlawful.
law.history: Created 2005 Ky. Acts ch. 150, sec. 15, effective June 20, 2005.
